metadata.synopsis: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.

25.speaker: Arron
25.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

57.speaker: Arron
57.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

49.speaker: Arron
49.text: Is there anything you need? I lower my prices for fellow druids.

24.speaker: Arron
24.text: But you'll need to be quick - the ritual will be complete before too long.

55.speaker: Arron
55.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: What ritual are you talking about?

39.speaker: Arron
39.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

38.speaker: Arron
38.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

32.speaker: Arron
32.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

14.speaker: Arron
14.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You just said the region's overrun by monsters. They won't survive by themselves.

31.speaker: Arron
31.text: As I said, it's a drastic measure. But the survival of the grove is paramount.

13.speaker: Arron
13.text: There just aren't enough supplies to support everyone.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Dire times. High stakes. I understand.

34.speaker: Arron
34.text: You sound just like Kagha. Oh, that it had to come to this...

17.speaker: Arron
17.text: I pray to Silvanus each night - the Wild Father will protect those refugees. I hope.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

0.speaker: Arron
0.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

56.speaker: Arron
56.text: I don't want this to happen either, but Kagha makes the decisions.

33.speaker: Arron
33.text: I can do nothing but pray to Silvanus in the hopes that He'll protect them.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Your prayers won't save them. But your voice might sway Kagha.

8.speaker: Arron
8.text: You don't know Kagha. She won't listen. I'm truly sorry.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Are you really locking down the grove?

11.speaker: Arron
11.text: I know it's drastic, but more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: add tag to check if halsin isn't back yet

35.speaker: Arron
35.text: I pray no goblin arrow has grazed you!

27.speaker: Arron
27.text: Nettie could put you to rights. She should be with the others in the inner chambers, but I doubt she'll be taking on new patients. The grove will be locked down soon.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: So you're really locking down the grove?

4.speaker: Arron
4.text: Nettie's your best bet, with Master Halsin gone. She should be with the others in the inner chambers.

51.speaker: Arron
51.text: Just some bits and bobs I no longer need.

44.speaker: Arron
44.text: Refugees, adventurers - no one in years and suddenly we're overwhelmed.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'd like to see your wares.

19.speaker: Arron
19.text: Always happy to help those who follow the First Circle.

20.speaker: Arron
20.text: Of course. But please remember: you're not the only one in need.
